attributes.action: Limit the amount of time cifas can stay on your credit to 13 months
attributes.additional_details: Today having a bank account to do online transactions and make contactless payments is a necessity.A cifas marker most times affects young people who unknowingly become money mules.Or it even affects online sellers who are paid with a hacked account or by a fraudulent charge back.Banning people from having a bank account for 6 years puts a strain on their lives and relegates them to a financial Stone Age. With 1.3 million unbanked in the UK, we should take steps in improving financial inclusion.
attributes.background: Prevent banks from putting a cifas marker on people’s accounts for longer than 13 months for first time offenders.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about taking action in the case of fraud is a matter for individual banks and fraud prevention bodies such CIFAS, not the Government or House of Commons.

As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.
